preqs: Twelve credit points of first-year Arts units

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACL1%, AEH1%, AMU1%, ASA1%, ATS1%, AZA1%}

unitName: Writing the world, the other and the self
description: The unit introduces students to the study of international, or world, literatures, focusing in particular on the multiple ways in which literature can shape our understanding of self, others and the world at large. These issues will be explored through texts from a range of different national and cultural traditions and across time that focus on cross-cultural encounters, exchange, and dialogue, including European narratives on Asia, Africa and Latin America (Orientalism) and international perspectives on the west (Occidentalism).
